During the last decade, we have gathered immense knowledge and experience in architecting software products and platforms. This knowledge base is an attempt to share such learning for the benefit of the community.

docs.title: Due Diligence Process
docs.description: This area will define the process we follow when it comes to performing a Technical Due Diligence (DD).

docs.title: Architecting at 99x
docs.description: 99X is a company that specialized in building software products and platforms. During the last decade, we have gathered immense knowledge and experience in architecting software products and platforms. This knowledge base is an attempt to share such learning for the benefit of the community.

docs.title: Overview
docs.description: Followings are the quality attributes that we are designing this template for.

docs.title: Product Architecture
docs.description: As you are already aware, coming up with the initial software architecture is one of the significant milestones of a software project. Therefore, as a technology company, it is essential to share the best practices across the organization to minimize errors while staying on budget. The 99X Architecture Process helps the architects to design the software architecture with guided steps to follow.

docs.title: 99x Wow (Way of Work)
docs.description: 99X has specialized in building software products and platforms for over a decade, amassing extensive knowledge on how to successfully deliver software products. This knowledge base aims to share that expertise for the benefit of Xians and others.

docs.description: 99X has specialized in building software products and platforms for over a decade, amassing extensive knowledge on how to successfully deliver software products. This knowledge base aims to share that expertise for the benefit of Xians and others.

docs.title: 99x WoW (Way of Work)
docs.description: Let's take a look at 99x wow model.

docs.title: Build
docs.description: This is the stage you have the highest flexibility to change the solution implementation at a lower cost. Once the product passes this stage, changes become costly due to the involvement of other stakeholders such as customers. You should make use of this stage to validate all the assumptions (technical, requirements, business) your team made during the previous stages.

frontMatter.title: Build
frontMatter.metaDescription: Validate the primary assumptions.

frontMatter.title: Architectural Runway
frontMatter.metaDescription: Incrementally prepare the architecture to support upcoming features and other requirements. Strike a balance between Big-Up-Front (BUF) and No-Up-Front (NUF). Set up architectural collaboration between the teams as the project gets bigger.

frontMatter.title: Code Quality Process
frontMatter.metaDescription: Establish a process to ensure code quality. Implement static code analysis and peer review processes to have a code that does what it should, follow a consistent style, is easy to understand, has been well-documented, and can be tested.

checklist.question: What is your strategy to ensure code quality?
checklist.expectation: Controls should be in place to ensure code quality, as a part of the team's product development process. Ensure findings are addressed correctly.

checklist.question: Have you set up a static code analysis tool?
checklist.expectation: A static code analysis tool should be in place. Reports from scans should be taken as input in code reviews/ pull-request merge process.

checklist.question: Are you tracking bug root causes?
checklist.expectation: The team should maintain a log of root causes for the bugs observed. Discuss the root causes and find ways to avoid them in retros.

frontMatter.title: Data Privacy Protection
frontMatter.metaDescription: Understand the data protection policies in target markets. Device strategies for data segregation and limit access to production data.

checklist.question: Do you have any data privacy related training programs under your training portfolio?
checklist.expectation: You need to integrate data privacy related training for your continuous training program.

checklist.question: Have you established any least privilege security models for your Network Access?
checklist.expectation: You need to implement a zero-trust security model for network accesss.

checklist.question: Do you have seperate environment for development, testing and production?
checklist.expectation: It's essential to separate these environments and enforce tight security measures to safeguard data from unauthorized access.

checklist.question: Have you established the required governance for data security to meet regulatory requirements?
checklist.expectation: Ensure that your product and the teams follow the guidelines and meet the regulatory requirements applicable to your company, depending on geography and domain.

checklist.question: Have you established IDS and IPS for your software product?
checklist.expectation: It's essential to prepare and establish best practices to prevent threats and to prepare to respond if any such activity occurs.

frontMatter.title: Feature Prioritization Process
frontMatter.metaDescription: Set up a process to identify which features should go first. Specify the process to revisit the product roadmap as new knowledge becomes available.

checklist.question: Do you perform feature prioritization and established a process to communicate the priorities to all the stakeholders?
checklist.expectation: Define the priority levels for features and establish a process to prioritize work, and communicate to all the stakeholders in advance before moving to development.

frontMatter.title: Lead Capture/CMS
frontMatter.metaDescription: Set up tools and workflows to capture and manage your potential customers. Invest in a Customer Relationship Management system to automate and provide a consistent experience.

checklist.question: Are tools and workflows in place to capture and manage your potential customers?
checklist.expectation: Tools and workflows should be set up (e.g. a customer relationship management system) to ensure the consistent customer experience.

checklist.question: What lead capture techniques do you use?
checklist.expectation: The use of proven lead capture techniques will speed up the potential customer converting process. CMS tools could also help in this area.

frontMatter.title: Market Feedback Capture
frontMatter.metaDescription: Build mechanisms to continuously feed the product development team with user feedback, sales team findings, competition behavior, and support team findings.

checklist.question: What is your strategy for capturing market feedback?
checklist.expectation: A mechanism should be in place to allow the product development team to know market feed.

checklist.question: How you utilize market feedback in the product development process?
checklist.expectation: Received market feedback should be managed and utilized in product development (e.g. feature designing, UX improvements, etc)

frontMatter.title: Portfolio Management
frontMatter.metaDescription: Enable productization to extend your product into a portfolio. Define a unified user experience, each product's Unique Value Proposition (UVP), integration between products, and formulation of a clear message to market.

checklist.question: Have you identified your product portfolio?
checklist.expectation: You need to identify your product portfolio to meet market demands.

checklist.question: Do you perform product portfolio management activities?
checklist.expectation: You need to perform product portfolio management activities, from planning to execution, to optimize the product-market fit.

frontMatter.title: Product Pricing Plan
frontMatter.metaDescription: Define the strategy to bill customers. Communicate your strategy such as price/feature tiers and pay as you go.

checklist.question: Have you defined a pricing strategy for your product?
checklist.expectation: You need to identify different pricing strategies applicable to your product.

checklist.question: Have you defined pricing for different user segments?
checklist.expectation: After identifying the appropriate pricing strategies, you need to set the prices accordingly to your market.

checklist.question: Do you have processes in place to continuously change the pricing depending on the market demands?
checklist.expectation: Have you establish processes and practices to adjust the pricing depending on the market demands continuously.

frontMatter.title: Release Gate Review
frontMatter.metaDescription: Define what levels of code quality, performance/load testing matrices that qualify as passed for a production release. Implement automation or manual verification.

frontMatter.title: Team Onboarding & Learning Plan
frontMatter.metaDescription: Create a quick ramp-up guide on both domain, technical and process knowledge for new team members. Make them aware of their purpose responsibilities in the team.

checklist.question: Have you defined a set of etiquette and guidelines to be followed throughout the hiring process?
checklist.expectation: Define a set of etiquette and guidelines to be followed throughout the hiring process(from interview setup to contract signing).

checklist.question: Have you defined a pre-boarding checklist?
checklist.expectation: Define a checklist of items to get done after hiring a new employee but before their first day at work(setting up necessary accounts, planning out the first day on-boarding sessions etc.).

checklist.question: Have you devised a proper program to continuously support the new recruit to effectively adapt to your organization?
checklist.expectation: Devise a proper program to continuously support the new recruit to effectively adapt to your organization(buddy program, mentor program etc.). This should include a mechanism to evaluate the effectiveness of new employee on-boarding as well.

frontMatter.title: Technical Debt Management
frontMatter.metaDescription: Create a process to identify and manage technical debt during product development. Think of time allocation for non-functional improvements in each sprint.

checklist.question: Do you maintain a backlog of technical issues?
checklist.expectation: The team should maintain a backlog of technical debt.

checklist.question: What is your strategy in addressing technical debt?
checklist.expectation: The team should have a strategy to allocate sufficient capacity to address technical debt.

frontMatter.title: Test Automation Setup
frontMatter.metaDescription: Identify the high priority areas for test automation. E.g., regression tests and repetitive tests. Make the tests run on commits and deployments.

checklist.question: Have you thought of having automated test cases in your project?
checklist.expectation: Automated test cases can help testing activity to a greater extent in terms of time saving, efficiency and reliability

checklist.question: Did you do an analysis on which test cases to be automated?
checklist.expectation: Identifying the correct test cases to automate is crucial. As trying to automate the wrong test cases might cause negative impacts to the project.

checklist.question: How did you arrive at the tools and technology to be used in the automation?
checklist.expectation: Identifying the best technology and tools to develop the automation framework is important in order match with the application under test and team composition.

frontMatter.title: User Behavior Analysis
frontMatter.metaDescription: Build mechanisms to track and analyze user behavior within the system to improve features and provide better UX.

checklist.question: Have you implemented any user behavior analysis system for your application?
checklist.expectation: You need to find the right tools and capture user behavior data to analyze user behavior and optimize the application for improved usability.

checklist.question: Do you inform your users that you collect these data?
checklist.expectation: It is necessary to inform the users that you collect the user's behavior data and the criteria for analysis to comply with privacy regulations like GDPR.

frontMatter.title: User License Management
frontMatter.metaDescription: Build mechanisms for managing license agreements with users. Track usage for relevant features, license expiry, reminders, payments, etc. Implement restrictions based on price tiers and usage.

checklist.question: Have you identified the suitable license type for your product?
checklist.expectation: Identify the suitable license among various types of licenses such as Per device, Per user, Subscription, GPL, CAL, Capacity based license, Freeware etc...

checklist.question: How do you track licenses of the existing customers?
checklist.expectation: You should identify how to track the license expiration, payments and sending reminders.

frontMatter.title: Visitor Behaviour Analysis
frontMatter.metaDescription: Build and evolve plans analyze the patterns of potential customers to your marketing sites.

checklist.question: What behavior analysis tools are you using to track visitor behavior?
checklist.expectation: A qualitative tool should be integrated with marketing sites to analyze user experience.

checklist.question: How do you utilize all the insights to optimize the visitor experience?
checklist.expectation: The team should have a strategy in optimizing user experience using all the insights captured from marketing sites.

frontMatter.title: Vulnerability Assessment
frontMatter.metaDescription: Perform continuous cycles of identifying, classifying, prioritizing, remediating, and mitigating of software vulnerabilities of the implemented code and third-party components.

checklist.question: Identify the application components that are vulnerable to security braches
checklist.expectation: You should check the security of the web servers, application servers, Database, etc... and identify security vulnerabilities

checklist.question: Did you identify the root causes of the identified security vulnerabilities?
checklist.expectation: Identifying the root causes will guide you on the correct direction to remediate them.

checklist.question: Identify the risks associated with the security vulnerabilities
checklist.expectation: You should identify the affected systems, affected data, affected business functions, potential damage and prioratize the vunerabilities to take immediate actions.

docs.title: Explore
docs.description: This is the initial stage where you come up with an idea to solve an identified problem. It is important at this stage to take a complete view of the problem domain. Explore different possibilities before locking down on a focused product concept.

frontMatter.title: Explore
frontMatter.metaDescription: Consider diverse alternatives to solve an identified problem.

frontMatter.title: Competitor Analysis
frontMatter.metaDescription: Used to measure how competitive your product or service is against the competition.

checklist.question: Have you identified your competitors?
checklist.expectation: Define the industry that you are in and identify the direct and indirect competitors.

checklist.question: Have you done a SWOT analysis of your competitors?
checklist.expectation: Analyze the Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats of your competitors to understand the competition better.

checklist.question: Do you have a competitive analysis template to assess your competitors?
checklist.expectation: The competitive analysis template should assess all your competitors against the key competitive advantages, target market, market share, product and services, and marketing strategy.

frontMatter.title: Financial Viability
frontMatter.metaDescription: Does the product idea have potential to generate enough revenue to sustain the business and cover the costs. Its what helps you select the best product idea that provides the best ROI.

checklist.question: Have you identified your total cost of ownership?
checklist.expectation: Identified production cost & identified operational cost to determine the breakeven cost.

checklist.question: Have you identified your potential market?
checklist.expectation: Analysis on total addressable market and risk factor analysis of each demography.

checklist.question: Have you identified the optimal pricing point?
checklist.expectation: Identified total addressable market and projection of sales revenue at different pricing points.

checklist.question: Have you done a competitor analysis?
checklist.expectation: Analysis of competitor analysis and justification on why would customers favor our product at the specified price point.

frontMatter.title: Market Segmentation
frontMatter.metaDescription: The process of dividing a target market into smaller, more defined categories. It segments customers and audiences into groups that share similar characteristics, such as demographics, interests, needs, or location.

checklist.question: Have you identified the different segments of your target market?
checklist.expectation: Maintain a document explaining the different characteristics of each market segment.

frontMatter.title: Megatrend Analysis
frontMatter.metaDescription: Megatrends represent potential behavioral or attitudinal changes over the course of time in your consumers/users.  Megatrend analysis answers the question What is happening? at a macro level.

checklist.question: Have you identified the factors driving long-term behavioural and attitude changes of your target market?
checklist.expectation: Maintain a document explaining the significance of each of the identified factor.

checklist.question: Can your team members explain the megatrends that can potentially disrupt the domain you are operating?
checklist.expectation: Maintain a shared understanding regarding important megatrends through a document.

frontMatter.title: Personas
frontMatter.metaDescription: A tool used to identify the types of users in the product. The product is designed specifically to target their needs instead of a generic set of users.

checklist.question: Have you identified the relevant Personas and documented them for your software product?
checklist.expectation: Identify the different Personas relevant to your software product by analyzing data, conducting interviews & etc and create a document containing all these information in one place.

checklist.question: Have you conducted any survey's to gather Persona information?
checklist.expectation: Define the survery questionaries and process you used to gather Personas and document them for future reference.

frontMatter.title: Product Concept Pitch Deck
frontMatter.metaDescription: Pitching is necessary to acquire customers, investors, team members for products. A successful pitching strategy depends on your audience. Thats why its important to learn the tips and tricks of a great pitch.

checklist.question: Do you have a pitch deck to present your product?
checklist.expectation: Define the competition within your industry. Identify the companies that share the market with products or services that are in direct and indirect competition with your business.

checklist.question: Does it cover the 5 important areas?
checklist.expectation: Your pitch deck should state the purpose, marketing and sales, milestones, competition, business model.

checklist.question: New Question
checklist.expectation: The Question Description

frontMatter.title: User Journey
frontMatter.metaDescription: A visualization of an individuals experience with a product or service over time and across different perspectives. Mapping these experiences is a vital part of being a human-centered business, and its essential to look at both aspects  what the person experiences, and what went on outside of their view to make it happen. Customer journey mapping and service blueprinting are two complementary methods that can help you see both sides of your services. Yet these two methods; the journey map and the service blueprint, and how they differ from each other are often confused.

checklist.question: Do you have a user-journey map created for your product?
checklist.expectation: Create a user jouney map for your product. Document it in one place for future reference.

frontMatter.title: Value Proposition
frontMatter.metaDescription: The primary value the product delivers to customers. This is the declaration of intent to customers on why the product exists, how it operates, and why it deserves their attention.

checklist.question: Have you identified the customer profile of your target audience?
checklist.expectation: Maintain a document explaining the tasks the target audience requires to do, the pain points, and gains.

checklist.question: Have you identified the value map of your product offers to the target market?
checklist.expectation: Maintain a document explaining the mappings pain relievers offered and the gain creators for the targeted customer profile from your product.

docs.title: Focus
docs.description: During the explore stage, you usually come up with a vast amount of ideas and value propositions the product may offer. The success of a product has no direct connection to the number of features it offers. Therefore, a smaller set of cohesive, tuned (targeted) features is usually more effective than a large set of features.

frontMatter.title: Focus
frontMatter.metaDescription: Select an area of specialization to target

frontMatter.title: Brand Story Development
frontMatter.metaDescription: There is already too much noise out there. People no longer care for sales pitches. The only thing they listen to and care about is an authentic story.

checklist.question: What is the primary value of your product?
checklist.expectation: Identification of the real problem that the customers are willing to pay money to solve.

checklist.question: What stimulates your target audience emotionally?
checklist.expectation: Identification of a key factors that stimulates the audience. This is not the features of your product but rather what your product enable customer to do. How does your customers use your product to enhance their potential.

checklist.question: What is the story?
checklist.expectation: At the end of this activity there should be a compelling story that is powerful enough to influence customers yet familiar to their reality.

frontMatter.title: Business Model Design
frontMatter.metaDescription: A Business Model is a visualization of how a company plans to operate, create value and make money. The Business Model Canvas consists of nine cells that capture different aspects of a business. It can be used to describe different companies from a startup to a large enterprise.

checklist.question: MJ_Test_Demo-Do you have your business model documented in the form of a canvas (or an equivalent)?
checklist.expectation: MJ_Test_Demo-Visualize the business model of your product to analyze and optimize how the front-stage (customer-facing elements) and back-stage (partners, key activities, key resources and cost) operate in synergy.

checklist.question: Do you define your product features under Value Proposition?
checklist.expectation: You shouldn't actually mention product features here, rather, think about benefits your product will offer your customers.

checklist.question: If you do the activities listed in 'Customer Relationships', will you be able to find and enough retain customers to build a sustainable business?
checklist.expectation: Customers are key in any business. Your plan here has to be well thought through.

checklist.question: If you do the activities listed on the left, will you be able to deliver all customer facing (right side) activities effectively?
checklist.expectation: Analyze and find out how coherent the different segments are in your business model.

frontMatter.title: Feasibility Study
frontMatter.metaDescription: Verify if the planned solution is feasible to build, operate and gain market traction with resources available to you.

checklist.question: What is the price of the product and how does it compare against the competition?
checklist.expectation: The team should have clearly identified the selling price and the operational cost component which goes into each item. The profit component should be identified. The price needs to be compared against the competition to assess the market viability of the product.

checklist.question: Do you have strategy in place to keep a steady cash flow throughout the product life cycle?
checklist.expectation: The team should have identified the total cost required before the product makes any revenue and there should be sufficient investment to support that. Thereafter, the team should have identified the cost at each stage and strategies to stay cash flow positive throughout.

checklist.question: Is it operational feasible to keep the business a float?
checklist.expectation: The team should have identified the operational challenges such as delivery, production, etc.. There should be strategies in place to overcome those challenges.

checklist.question: Is your product or architecture technically feasible to implement?
checklist.expectation: There should be evidence to prove that the team has identified the key quality attributes properly and their celling constraints. Team should have tested the architecture for those corner cases.

frontMatter.title: Low Fidelity Prototype
frontMatter.metaDescription: A prototype is a simulation of how the primary functionality of the product will work. It allows you to initiate discussions with other stakeholders such as domain experts, potential users, decision makers, etc. Low-fidelity (lo-fi) prototyping is a quick and easy way to convert high-level design concepts into tangible and testable artifacts. It doesnt have to be concrete or even look like a finished product.

checklist.question: Have you identified who needs to be involved in low-fidelity prototyping?
checklist.expectation: The idea is to get as many parties on board in this process as possible. Developers, QA, domain experts and especially users are more than welcome to participate in this process.

checklist.question: Have you figured out a technique for this process?
checklist.expectation: Low fidelity prototypes can change quite often. Hence it is recommended to use a media where things can be changed quickly; such as pen and paper. Wire framing can be done at a later stage when the requirements are bit more stable.

checklist.question: Have you figured out what to do after this process?
checklist.expectation: It is important that the findings and notes captured in this process is properly recorded for future purposes. These early feedback then needs to be taken into planning and should eventually needs to end up at the product road map.

frontMatter.title: MVP Identification
frontMatter.metaDescription: Identify the minimum set of features that can gain maximum learning as quickly as possible. In the book 'Lean Startup', Erik Ries defines a MVP: A Minimum Viable Product (MVP) helps entrepreneurs start the process of learning as quickly as possible. It is not necessarily the smallest product imaginable, though; it is simply the fastest way to get through the Build-Measure-Learn feedback loop with the minimum amount of effort.

checklist.question: Have you created MVPs for your product before implementing the features?
checklist.expectation: Create MVPs before implementing the features of your product idea to identify the minimum set of features that can gain maximum value as quickly as possible.

checklist.question: Did you validate the MVP with the real users?
checklist.expectation: The MVPs must be tested with the real users as much as possible to reduce the waste of development effort and cost

checklist.question: Did you consider the matrices for "Value vs. Effort" and "Value vs. Risk" before implementing features?
checklist.expectation: By plotting the "Customer value" against "Effort" and "Customer value" against "Risk" will help you prioritize the features that need to be implemented first.

frontMatter.title: Problem Solution Fit Testing
frontMatter.metaDescription: Find out if the problem you picked is worth solving. The problem statement should effortlessly ring a bell with your customers. They should be willing to write a cheque to you for solving their problem!

checklist.question: Have you identified the problem that your product solves?
checklist.expectation: The problem has to be identified clearly. If you have to educate potential customers about the problem, you might as well solve a non-existing problem

checklist.question: How would customers rate your value proposition?
checklist.expectation: Does your solution falls under 'Nice to have', 'Should have' or 'Must have'? Its difficult to build a business model around 'Nice to have' ideas.

checklist.question: Did you talk to your potential customers to test your solution for the problem?
checklist.expectation: There is no other way of testing your problem solution fit other than talking to your potential customers. You can make calls, schedule meetings or send out surveys to collect information on how important it is for them to have the identified problem solved.

frontMatter.title: Productization Blueprint
frontMatter.metaDescription: Productization Blueprint is used to implement product-specific technical components such as multi-tenancy, licensing, standard APIs, plugins, etc.

checklist.question: How is your product or product portfolio managed in terms on security and communication?
checklist.expectation: If there is a portfolio of applications, then a single sign-on mechanism is highly recommended. Known federated ID mechanism such as Office 365, Google or Facebook is also worth considering. Communication between application should happen via known protocols and should be clearly isolated.

checklist.question: What is your product pricing and licensing strategy?
checklist.expectation: There should be a clear product based or feature based pricing model. Its typical to have the abilities for feature toggling for users to achieve better customization. Apart from this licensing model should be integrated to the system to measure usage and grant/restrict access accordingly.

checklist.question: What is your release management strategy?
checklist.expectation: Product road-map should align with releases. The architecture should support Feature Toggles,Canary Releases, Dark Launching, etc... to slowly roll out the change to a small subset of users for verification.

checklist.question: Have you identified your product branding and theming strategy?
checklist.expectation: This is especially needed when there is a portfolio of applications. Your product design should take necessary steps to have consistency among all applications.

frontMatter.title: Technical Architecture
frontMatter.metaDescription: Defines how granular software components are engineered and organized together to achieve the optimal delivery of the features in demand. The architecture is mainly governed by the product requirements. Its moderated by industry best practices associated with the selected technologies, services and relevant regulations.

checklist.question: Have you identified the key quality attributes of your product?
checklist.expectation: Key non-functional quality attributes such as security, performance, etc... needs to have been identified along with recommended technical strategies to overcome them.

checklist.question: Is the technical architecture clearly defined?
checklist.expectation: There should be a clear technical diagram outlining all major components. This should show how the above key quality attributes are addressed in the system.

checklist.question: Does your architecture support future scaling & extendability?
checklist.expectation: The technical architecture should have provisioning to scale as the application scales. Clear separation needs to be maintained between different components to enable both scaling out and up independently.

checklist.question: How do you maintain security of your system and customer data?
checklist.expectation: Architecture should have made measures to provide tight security. There should be evidences of OWASP testing. Also, customer data needs to be accessed securely to meet data protection standards such as GDPR. Encryption at rest can be considered here.

checklist.question: Have you validated your architecture to ensure the corner cases?
checklist.expectation: All the ceiling values of non-functional requirements needs to be identified. There should be evidences to make sure that the technical architecture can support such data loads specified in SLAs.

docs.title: Formatting Guidelines
docs.description: Some introduction text. Lists out all the headings from h1 to h6. Easy to customise.

frontMatter.title: Formatting Guidelines
frontMatter.metaTitle: This is the title tag of this page
frontMatter.metaDescription: This is the meta description

docs.title: Syntax Highlighting
docs.description: The following is a code block with JavaScript language syntax highlighting.

frontMatter.title: Syntax Highlighting
frontMatter.metaTitle: Syntax Highlighting is the meta title tag for this page
frontMatter.metaDescription: This is the meta description for this page

docs.title: Harvest
docs.description: This is the stage your product returns the investment. The focus of this stage is to retain happy and loyal customers, up-sell more, and get referrals to grow the business. You need very stable operational processes to respond to customer issues and inquiries. Build and tune your sales and marketing processes to capture a greater market share.

frontMatter.title: Harvest
frontMatter.metaDescription: Operate with the highest return on investment.

frontMatter.title: Contingency and Reliability Reviews
frontMatter.metaDescription: Plan and action business continuity strategy to minimize business risks. Consider technical, market, and environmental factors. Ensure the readiness with various drills.

checklist.question: Have you identified potential risks to your day to day operations?
checklist.expectation: All possible threats needs to be identified and the team should have an idea about possibility and the impact of those unfortunate situations.

checklist.question: Have you established a contingency plan?
checklist.expectation: A plan should be in place with alternatives for each of the above mentioned potential threats. The team should be aware of the plan.

checklist.question: Have you done a contingency drill?
checklist.expectation: It is vital that the team has done a test of the contingency plan. It is better to be prepared for all conditions.

frontMatter.title: Continuous Improvement Strategy
frontMatter.metaDescription: Rapidly respond to market conditions and learnings to sustain a competitive edge. Iteratively improve the product by aligning with business goals and timelines.

checklist.question: Have you identified industry trends and competitors?
checklist.expectation: Overview of market research, industry trends analysis and competitor analysis.

checklist.question: Have you identified any under-served niche?
checklist.expectation: Overview of product research to exploit a currently under-served niche and identify if there any need you could potentially fulfill.

checklist.question: Have you considered "build or buy" decisions?
checklist.expectation: Where your product should buy or build themself considering Risk, Cost and Problem.

frontMatter.title: Hot-fix Process
frontMatter.metaDescription: Team and process arrangement to release an update to fix a critical or major error while maintaining SLA obligations in production.

checklist.question: Do you have a validation in place to determine what is worthy of a hot-fix?
checklist.expectation: There should be a process in place to assess the issue at hand and to determine whether it is required to do a hot-fix for the job at hand. Basically what ever that can wait until the next release should not be a hot-fix and objective should be to minimize hot-fixes as much as possible.

checklist.question: What is the hot-fix process in your team?
checklist.expectation: The team should have a defined process to do hot-fixes and it should include the branching strategy, deployment strategy, testing strategy and required time allocation with in a sprint.

checklist.question: How is the release aspect of the hot-fix handled?
checklist.expectation: The actual release needs to communicated to the customers and the downtime needs to be managed in such away that it does not effect the daily activities. The team should have a defined plan for this.

frontMatter.title: Inbound Market Planning
frontMatter.metaDescription: Enables the product to be found by the potential customers through content publishing or through digital marketing messages.

frontMatter.title: Lead nurture pipeline
frontMatter.metaDescription: Start educating prospects, build awareness of your organization and its products. Build trust and a good relationship to ensure the potential client chooses you when it is time to buy.

frontMatter.title: Monitoring and Incident Management
frontMatter.metaDescription: Monitor system health detect and alert regarding system malfunctions and failures. While exception monitoring deals with problems within the product, incident management deals with problems on the larger stack of software and hardware.

frontMatter.title: Public Relations Activity Plan
frontMatter.metaDescription: Strategize to enhance the image of the product brand and focus on influential media strategies.

checklist.question: Did you research on PR strategies?
checklist.expectation: Review your previous efforts, why did it worked or not? If you are new to the market, tactics of your competitors and others in your industry.

checklist.question: Have you identified your goals and outcomes?
checklist.expectation: Your PR strategy should tie in with your overall goals and objectives.

checklist.question: Have you identified any opportunities?
checklist.expectation: Identify events or activities that present great opportunities for good public relations activities. In doing so, its a good idea to look at both internal and external events.

frontMatter.title: Referrals and Upsales Plan
frontMatter.metaDescription: A marketing plan makes use of recommendations and word of mouth to grow the products customer base through the networks of its existing customers while establishing customer loyalty.
metaTags: Referrals and up a sales plan

checklist.question: Have you identified the forms of promotions worked for the target market?
checklist.expectation: Overview of the target market, previous referral programs, promotions and their impact.

checklist.question: Have you planed the time and resources investment for referral programs?
checklist.expectation: The program should be strategically planned out, regularly measured, and managed on an ongoing basis.

checklist.question: Did you set up goals?
checklist.expectation: Referral goals like referring X number of people or earning Y points, average upsales brings by new customers into the business from referrals.

frontMatter.title: Scalability Verification
frontMatter.metaDescription: Ensure your application scales as users grow. Explore scale up and scale out strategies while maintaining SLA obligations and efficient cost of operations.

checklist.question: Has your platform architecture provisioning for scalability?
checklist.expectation: Cloud vendors provide scalability requirements out of the box, but your architecture should have placed important components such as load balancers, decoupling patters, etc... Explore scale up and scale down mechanisms.

checklist.question: Have you defined performance benchmarks?
checklist.expectation: Verify that performance benchmarks defined during initial architecture.

checklist.question: Have you setup performance metrics monitoring?
checklist.expectation: Monitoring to gather data from all deployed resources ensure that the throughput KPIs are met and the limitations are communicated to the entire team . Overview of monitoring mechanisms.

frontMatter.title: Technology Revamp/Migration Plan
frontMatter.metaDescription: A roadmap to move to better technologies, to facilitate a rapid response process, while boosting security, availability, performance, and agility.

checklist.question: Have you identified the requirement for technology revamp/migration?
checklist.expectation: Determine technical, time, and financial requirements.

checklist.question: Have you identified the risks of technology revamp/migration?
checklist.expectation: Provide an assessment of cost, duration, commitment from stakeholders, privacy-related risks.

checklist.question: Have you identified the most optimized way?
checklist.expectation: Map and analyze these high prioritized features and pain-points with new product design.

checklist.question: Have you assessed the impact?
checklist.expectation: Once the update is completed, assess the impact and cost.

frontMatter.title: Win-lose Analysis
frontMatter.metaDescription: Do a win-loss analysis on your leads to understand why you lost and what the strong points in your application are. Analyze these results with different demographics in mind.

checklist.question: Is there a Win-Loss analysis in place?
checklist.expectation: A history of studying both wins and losses of sales. There should be records to prove that customer opinion of the product is collected.

checklist.question: Is the team using the insights of the analysis to rectify the mistakes?
checklist.expectation: The team should do root cause analysis of issues that were pointed out by the customers. There should be a process to make this as a input to the future product road-map.

docs.title: Immerse
docs.description: Once the focus (niche) is defined, its time to dig deep into to the elaborate details required to solve the problem. During the immerse phase, the team should look into the details of the solution, its features, associated costs, timelines, etc. A lot of 'what if' analysis and the base artifacts required for detailed planning is generated here.

frontMatter.title: Immerse
frontMatter.metaDescription: Dig deep and understand the solution.

frontMatter.title: Brand Guide
frontMatter.metaDescription: Define the brand personality of the product, including composition, design & visual theme, general look-and-feel, logo, name, etc.

checklist.question: MI_Test_Demo-What is the unique message that you want to convey with your branding?
checklist.expectation: MI_Test_Demo-A simple but a powerful message that is instantly comprehendible.

checklist.question: How do you position your brand visually?
checklist.expectation: A consistent color code, distinguishable logo and other UI elements has to be in place and people needs to instantly identify your brand via these elements.

checklist.question: What is the target audience of the product?
checklist.expectation: The team has identified the target demographies clearly and should be aware of the preferences of those demographies.

frontMatter.title: Data Architecture
frontMatter.metaDescription: Data architecture is composed of models, policies and rules or standards that govern which data is collected, data relationships, how it is stored, arranged, integrated, and processed.

checklist.question: Have you identified the information that needs to be stored and their relationships with each other?
checklist.expectation: There should be a data relationship diagram; something like an ER diagram. Everyone in the team should be aware of what is stored and the relationship between stored entities.

checklist.question: Have you identified the security concerns regarding the stored data and their access levels?
checklist.expectation: Team should be aware of what data entities needs to be kept secured and who can have access to those data. According to some data regulations such as GDPR, it could be that even the development team should not have access to some sensitive data.

checklist.question: Have you optimized the data storage considering performance?
checklist.expectation: The team should have identified the read and write performance constraints for each data entity and the data architecture should address those concerns. The team should also consider replication strategies for distributed applications.

checklist.question: What is the data storage strategy?
checklist.expectation: Team should have decided on a storage strategy such as relational DB, No-Sql, etc... There should be a good justification for the selection based on cost, performance, etc...

checklist.question: Does your data architecture consider possible future data analytics requirements?
checklist.expectation: Team should have at least consider a data model to represent different dimensions of data. There could be a data analytics model such as a Kimball model that is independent of the main data model.

frontMatter.title: Engineering Estimations
frontMatter.metaDescription: Estimating the development efforts for functional and non-functional features.

checklist.question: How do you estimate functional and non-functional features in your project?
checklist.expectation: An explanation of the estimation process used in the project.

checklist.question: What is the Task/Method Estimation aka Bottom-up Estimation?
checklist.expectation: An explanation of the popular Task/Method estimation and its key pointers

checklist.question: Where would you use the Heuristic Method of estimation?
checklist.expectation: If there are analogus estimations that had been done for similar features in the same or other projects.

frontMatter.title: High Fidelity Prototype
frontMatter.metaDescription: Build a detailed prototype to demonstrate how the final product would operate and obtain feedback.

checklist.question: How do you validate new features and user flows with the target users before the actual implementation?
checklist.expectation: Make use of High-fidelity prototypes to validate the user flows, interactions and user behaviours

checklist.question: What elements do you include in your high fidelity prototypes?
checklist.expectation: High fidelity prototype should include visuals, user flows, required transitions and animations

checklist.question: What tools and software do you use to create high fidelity prototypes?
checklist.expectation: Choose a tool that the team is comfortable with. i.e. Sketch, photoshop, Illustrator etc...

frontMatter.title: Operational Costs
frontMatter.metaDescription: Running cost estimations in operation including infrastructure and training.

frontMatter.title: Positioning Messages
frontMatter.metaDescription: A real message to test against the target market. It could be a tagline, short pitch, or an ad message. Eventually, it is the way the product is defined to consumers on important attributes.

checklist.question: Where do you want to position the brand in peoples' minds?
checklist.expectation: The team should have identified the product placement with respect to cost and unique offerings.

checklist.question: How effective is your message?
checklist.expectation: The positioning message should be short, easy to comprehend and easy to remember.

frontMatter.title: Product Market Fit Validation
frontMatter.metaDescription: Makes sure that your product is well tuned to solve the problem specifically for the identified target market.

checklist.question: How did you identify the target customers for your product/service?
checklist.expectation: We need to follow the four steps of the product market fit i.e. Discover, Test, Position and Verify

checklist.question: What are the measurements of Product Market Fit for your product/service?
checklist.expectation: We can make use of indicators such as Product Usage Interval, Net Promoter Score, Retention Curve, Growth Rate etc...

frontMatter.title: Product Roadmap
frontMatter.metaDescription: Prioritize and lay the features and releases in a product evolution timeline.

checklist.question: Do you have a product roadmap?
checklist.expectation: The team should have a product roadmap that is appropriate to the nature of the product. It could be a no-dates road map, hybrid road map or timeline road map

checklist.question: How do you prioritize the roadmap?
checklist.expectation: The success of the product roadmap lies upon the prioritization which could be based upon customer requirements

checklist.question: Do you use a tool to build the product roadmap?
checklist.expectation: You can make use of tools such as Jira, Aha!, Product Plan, Roadmunk etc... to help building the product roadmap

docs.title: Winning Product Learning Portal
docs.description: Go to Introduction section to start learning.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.description: Read through the sections and learn to build a market winning product. This portal has comprehensive details on all required Winning Product Strategic Activities.

frontMatter.title: Introduction
frontMatter.metaDescription: Welcome to the Winning Product learning site

docs.title: Areas of Excellence
docs.description: In our experience, broadly, there are four areas your team must excel in developing a market winning product. You will find the importance and the descriptions of these 4 'areas of excellence' below.

frontMatter.title: Areas of Excellence
frontMatter.metaDescription: Technology is just one factor in product development. There are other factors essential in creating a successful product.

frontMatter.title: Why Winning Product is necessary?
frontMatter.metaTitle: Why Winning Product is necessary? | WP
frontMatter.metaDescription: 'Winning Product' was initiated to help product teams with important strategic activities to stay ahead of their competition.

docs.title: Product Lifecycle
docs.description: Winning Product Canvas divides the product's lifecycle into 8 stages. These stages are unlike the Waterfall phases. They are iterative at product level, module level and even at feature level. These stages differ in subtle but important ways. By understanding the focus of each stage, you can understand the strategic activities within it.

frontMatter.title: Product Lifecycle
frontMatter.metaDescription: Regardless of the domain, all software products have a life cycle. The Product Life Cycle (PLC) is the cycle of stages that a new or redeveloped product goes through, from start to finish. Understanding how to manage that product life cycle through each stage determines the success or failure of a product.

docs.title: Differences in Software Products
docs.description: Common mistake of novice product teams is that they overlook the specialty of 'product' development. Product development is vastly different from bespoke/enterprise application development. Following sections outline some of the reasons behind the differences:

frontMatter.title: Differences in Software Products
frontMatter.metaDescription: Software product management and engineering is a specialty that differs from enterprise or bespoke applications.

docs.title: What is a Winning Product?
docs.description: There are 4 key 'areas of excellence' that contribute to the success of your product.

frontMatter.title: What is a Winning Product?
frontMatter.metaTitle: What is a Winning Product | WP
frontMatter.metaDescription: A product that's intuitive to use and extremely simple to understand is a market winner. Is there a greater validation for a product than its users? Thats why, to build a winning product you require much more than engineering excellence.

frontMatter.title: Winning Product Mindset
frontMatter.metaDescription: The correct Mindset helps you to follow certain guiding principles when conducting strategic activities to build a winning product.

docs.title: Optimize
docs.description: When you reach this stage all your major assumptions should be validated. Product UVP must be clear and willingness of the customers to pay for that value proposition has to be confirmed. This means most of the core features are available and tested by your early customers during 'Build' stage.

frontMatter.title: Optimize
frontMatter.metaDescription: Fine tune the product to achieve the maximum output.

frontMatter.title: Analytics Review Process
frontMatter.metaDescription: Gathering correct and current data and processing them to identify patterns and make predictions. Use this to enable data-driven decision making.

checklist.question: Have you defined the analytics data model?
checklist.expectation: There has to be an analytics representation of the transaction data. Something like a Kimball model/Star schema should be in place.

checklist.question: Do you have data driven standardized APIs?
checklist.expectation: The product should have standardized data driven APIs (apart from application APIs). These APIs should have authentication and data throttling concerns sorted.

checklist.question: How do you visualize the analyzed data?
checklist.expectation: Ideally the product should use established visualization tools such as PowerBI. It should use the above mentioned data end points to seamlessly connect to data instead of exposing the data base directly. Embedded analytics could also be used here.

checklist.question: Is analytics used for predictive modeling?
checklist.expectation: The presence of pattern identification using existing data. These patterns needs to be converted into business meaning and should be incorporated in decision making.

frontMatter.title: Compliance and Approvals
frontMatter.metaDescription: Adapt industry standards and certifications to design stronger, safer, more reliable products and get compliance approvals from relevant authorities and industry bodies (e.g: PCIDS, HIPAA, GDPR etc).

checklist.question: Have you identified regulatory requirements?
checklist.expectation: The team should have a good understanding on the regulatory implications which governs the product domain. Seeking legal advice on these matters is recommended here.

checklist.question: Do you have the necessary procedures in place?
checklist.expectation: There should be processes and procedures in place to make sure that the product covers the identified regulatory requirements. This could include additional automated security tests, data storage location validations, data at rest encryption procedures, etc...

checklist.question: Do you have evidence of compliance for the needed regulatory requirements?
checklist.expectation: The organization should strive to get certified on relevant regulatory requirements such as ISO, etc... For those requirements where there is no specific certification, try to get a reputed audit organization to assess and confirm the conformity.

frontMatter.title: Cost Optimization
frontMatter.metaDescription: Focuses on reducing cost. Consider shredding unnecessary waste in platform services, tech debt backlog, or team structure. Look into process improvements.

checklist.question: Have you identified and categorized all your costs?
checklist.expectation: All elements related to operational cost should be clearly visible and should be able to be listed.

checklist.question: Have you considered the cost alternatives for your business activities?
checklist.expectation: Best practices for each cost activity needs to be analyzed and the activity needs to be justified given the alternatives.

checklist.question: Does your spending add value to the product?
checklist.expectation: The product team must understand the ultimate value of the product to the customer. The costing should always add direct or indirect value to the end product.

frontMatter.title: Customer Contract Management
frontMatter.metaDescription: Correctly manage contracts (versioning, tools, etc.), Service-Level Agreements for customers.

checklist.question: What is your contract management strategy?
checklist.expectation: There should be a clear strategy on contract management and usage limits. All parties needs to be aware of any SLAs and limits which the product can support.

checklist.question: Have you defined matrices on key values in the SLA and do you have a live monitoring mechanism?
checklist.expectation: There should be metrics in place assess key performance indicators of the product. Having live dashboards such as application insights, newrelic, etc... with those parameters is very important here.

checklist.question: Do you have contract renewal strategy in place?
checklist.expectation: It is important to have a mechanism to renew contracts especially in a long running service level agreements. Renewals should facilitate price and other parameter adjustments if needed.

frontMatter.title: Customer Support
frontMatter.metaDescription: Plan and organize human resources, tools, documentation, training required, communication and troubleshooting capabilities to provide great customer service.

checklist.question: What is your customer satisfaction rating?
checklist.expectation: The team should have a good knowledge on how satisfied the customers are when using the product. They should know the pain points and what customers like about the product and most importantly need to know how generally satisfied customers are?. The idea behind this is to identify the improvements and also to have a generally good connection with customers.

checklist.question: Have you identified the customer engagement process?
checklist.expectation: The process after the product is sold or after care is also as important as the product it self. Depending on the product, there should be a solid plan to listen and solve customers needs. This could be social media, call center or even on site consultancy.

checklist.question: What are the legal requirements/SLA for product after care?
checklist.expectation: The team should have identified the legal constraints of their product after it has been sold. This could be various SLAs or other legal technicalities.

frontMatter.title: Log Indexing and Analysis
frontMatter.metaDescription: Process of reviewing, interpreting, and understanding logs to identify application health and to diagnose and rectify issues. Use this also to enable data-driven decision making.

checklist.question: Have you identified the purposes for which you need log analysis?
checklist.expectation: Define for which purposes you need to perform log analysis? (for troubleshooting, for user pattern recognition, etc.)

checklist.question: Have you identified the types of logs you should collect from each of your log sources?
checklist.expectation: Define what types of logs you should extract from each of your log sources. This should mainly depend on your identified purposes.

checklist.question: Have you identified the process of log data analysis with the right tools?
checklist.expectation: Identity how to collect, store, index, and analysis log data with tools and techniques that are right for you.

frontMatter.title: Performance Tuning Plan
frontMatter.metaDescription: Optimize system performance for the best user experience, based on performance requirements and analysis on existing performance.

checklist.question: Have you identified the requirements related to performance?
checklist.expectation: Overiew of the performance requirements. Higher throughput and lower latency is better for the overall performance of the product.

checklist.question: Have you carried out performance testing?
checklist.expectation: Throughout the product engineering lifecycle, its required to do different types of performance testing to identify performance bottlenecks.

checklist.question: Have you identified performance issues?
checklist.expectation: Overview of issues of identified components, subsystems and integrations to reach the benchmarked performance levels.

frontMatter.title: Promotions Process
frontMatter.metaDescription: A detailed plan including frequency, customer segments, market conditions, offerings, ad-word design, and messages.

checklist.question: Do you have a promotion plan for your product?
checklist.expectation: Your promotion plan should include strategies for Advertising, Personal selling, Sales promotions and Public relations

checklist.question: Have you identified the promotional technique(s) that best suits your product?
checklist.expectation: You should evaluate the effect of Advertising, Sales promotions, Public relations, Personal selling and identify the strengths and weaknesses of those techniques for your product.

checklist.question: Do you have a social media marketing strategy?
checklist.expectation: Social media promotions are an easy way of connecting with customers. You should identify how to use social media promotions effectively for your product.

frontMatter.title: Tech Team Branding
frontMatter.metaDescription: Defining a brand for the product team can have a powerful impact on the team's alignment, effectiveness, and engagement with each other and the rest of the organization.

checklist.question: Have your team done any publications?
checklist.expectation: The team should have written blog posts, articles or knowledge sharing videos on unique finding that they have done. The knowledge shared could be either technical or on unique challenges exists in the product domain. These should have been well received by the readers.

checklist.question: Have you shared the knowledge gained with the community via more hand on approaches as well?
checklist.expectation: It is vital to share knowledge via tech talks, meetups, etc... to position the team as a technically sound. The presence in the industry is a must and the team should have a positive feedback from the society.

checklist.question: Have you identified the core competency?
checklist.expectation: While positioning the team for technical soundness, it is also important to circle around a unique aspect which the team knows better than anyone else in the world. The team should have found that niche and their presentations and publications needs to wrap around that unique niche.

frontMatter.title: Web Optimization Plan
frontMatter.metaDescription: Offsite or onsite improvements provided for user experience so that people are more likely to convert on your website.

checklist.question: How do you plan to optimize your website for search engines?
checklist.expectation: Overiew of the Search Engine Optimization plan. How do you optimize web pages with keywords, meta descriptions, and titles relevant to the web site content.

checklist.question: How do you plan to optimize your website for visitors?
checklist.expectation: Overiew of the Conversion Rate Optimization plan. Tactics to be used to optimize conversions.

checklist.question: Do you measure and track your content's success?
checklist.expectation: How the contents affect on optimize your website for search engines.

docs.title: Plan
docs.description: Once you have analyzed the impact of different variations during the immerse phase, you can create the initial plans for the rest of the project. Most of these plans are live documents that are kept updated during rest of the stages.

frontMatter.title: Plan
frontMatter.metaDescription: Strategize the agility of project execution.

frontMatter.title: Architecture Blueprint
frontMatter.metaDescription: Describes the architectural representation of the system's components. At the inception implement a feature vertical and the setup of the required infrastructure to act as a guideline for further development.

checklist.question: Have you specified the traceability between architecture blueprint and requirements ?
checklist.expectation: Clearly illustrate how certain architectural decisions have been taken to address each product requirement. An architecture decision log should be available to understand how assumptions and validation has taken place over a period of time.

checklist.question: Have you identified architecturally significant requirements?
checklist.expectation: List of requirements covering functional and non functional which has a direct impact for product architecture

checklist.question: Have you documented various alternative architectures and tradeoff analysis before focusing on a specific architecture?
checklist.expectation: Artefact covering alternative architecture analysis covering aspects of typical quality attributes of the product

frontMatter.title: Customer Onboarding
frontMatter.metaDescription: Define customer onboarding process to seamlessly integrate customers across modules such as websites, demos, trials, licensing, payments, data migrations and resource provisioning.

checklist.question: Have you identified the user journey of customer onboarding process?
checklist.expectation: The user journey of customer onboarding is documented and validated across different modules of the product (demo, trials, website, data import, licensing, payment, etc.) as well as across different departments (marketing, sales, support, etc.).

checklist.question: What are the activities involved in your customer onboarding process?
checklist.expectation: i.e. Welcome artifacts, Meetings and Demos, Product registration, Tutorials etc..

checklist.question: Did you measure the quality of your customer onboarding process?
checklist.expectation: You can measure the quality of the onboarding process by gathering data via surveys, interviews, feedbacks etc...

frontMatter.title: Define Key Metric Tests
frontMatter.metaDescription: Define quantitative key matrices (timeline, quality, market success) that helps validate achievement of business goals.

frontMatter.title: Delivery Pipeline
frontMatter.metaDescription: Helps you automate steps in your software delivery process, such as initiating code builds, static code analysis, running automated tests, and deploying to a staging or production environment.

checklist.question: Have you setup key steps of the CI pipeline?
checklist.expectation: Ability to demonstrate CI configuration and execute CI job successfully having tasks such as, code quality analysis, unit test execution, security tests

checklist.question: Have you setup key steps of the CD pipeline?
checklist.expectation: Ability to demonstrate the key stages of the delivery such as executing infrastructure code, execute code to configure infrastructure, prmote artefacts across different stages of the pipeline, have different nonfunctional automated tests harnesses.

checklist.question: Have you identified release methods different to deployment techniques?
checklist.expectation: Ability to decouple deployments from releases

frontMatter.title: Detailed Data Schema
frontMatter.metaDescription: Focuses on how to store data efficiently for retrieval, cost, and performance. It also looks at data interaction interfaces (APIs) and data dimensions for analytic purposes.

checklist.question: Have you identify entities and attributes ?
checklist.expectation: OLTP and OLAP schemas are identified with their attributes and indexing techniques

checklist.question: Have you identified data access patterns?
checklist.expectation: Different data requirements needs different patterns eg. CQRS, Repository etc.

checklist.question: Is there a analysis done to chose between different storage types eg. Sql vs NoSql?
checklist.expectation: There should be clear analysis to accomodate entities belonging to Sql and NoSql with their indexing and associated costs

frontMatter.title: Digital Marketing Blueprint
frontMatter.metaDescription: A consolidated marketing plan including market segments, key messages, channels, lead capture, nurture, convert, up sale, referrals.

checklist.question: Do you have a digital marketing strategy?
checklist.expectation: You should have a digital marketing strategy because it allows you to reach a global marketplace from anywhere in the world.

checklist.question: Have you identified the customer personas for the digital marketing strategy?
checklist.expectation: Define quantitative demographics and qualitative information, and create a detailed profile for each of your personas

checklist.question: What are your digital marketing channels?
checklist.expectation: Gather what you have, and categorize each of your channels, so you have a clear picture of your existing owned, earned, and paid media.

frontMatter.title: Project Process
frontMatter.metaDescription: A set of activities and the systematic process that needs to be carried out to develop the product in both engineering and delivery disciplines.

checklist.question: PI_Test_Demo-Have you access to overall process guidance for the product engineering?
checklist.expectation: PI_Test_Demo-Team should have access to documented process policy, proceedures, and work instructions

checklist.question: Have you identified a development or engineering process?
checklist.expectation: A documented process clearly indicating why it has been selected. Eg. SCRUM along with product design proceedures

checklist.question: Have you identified a DevOps process?
checklist.expectation: A documented process clearly indicating why it has been selected over other devops processes eg. process which includes automated CD

checklist.question: Have you identified a quality engineering process?
checklist.expectation: A documented process clearly indicating why it has been selected eg. process which assures the quality across all stages of the lifecycle of the product

checklist.question: Have you identified a release management process?
checklist.expectation: A documented process clearly indicating why it has been selected eg. process which assures the suitable SLA and minimum lead time.

checklist.question: Have you identified a release management process?
checklist.expectation: A documented process clearly indicating why it has been selected eg. process which assures the suitable SLA and minimum lead time.

checklist.question: Have you identified a product management process?
checklist.expectation: A documented process clearly indicating why it has been selected eg. ability to translate business needs into a features to be engineered.

frontMatter.title: Errors and Exception Handling
frontMatter.metaDescription: Proactive monitoring and log analysis of potential and occurred errors to provide a graceful recovery and diagnostic capability for support teams.

checklist.question: Does the team members get automatically notified of the production errors?
checklist.expectation: Notifications has all information required to trace and help the effected user.

checklist.question: Is your error response process defined explicitly?
checklist.expectation: All relevant team members are trained on the process and follows it consistent?

checklist.question: Do you have a production error dashboard/report frequently accessible to all stakeholders?
checklist.expectation: Establish real-time information to the team and summary information to other stakeholders?

checklist.question: Do you followup with users when they encounter an error?
checklist.expectation: All such followups are recorded for analysis purposes.

checklist.question: Do you perform periodical analysis of error logs?
checklist.expectation: Summary information is shared with stakeholders in a manner the error response process improvements are visible.

frontMatter.title: Growth Hacker Plan
frontMatter.metaDescription: Explore low cost and smarter options to gain rapid market reach in a short time for growth through referrals and up-sales.

checklist.question: What are the means of your customers finding you (Awareness)?
checklist.expectation: Measurements of awareness effectiveness and cost of the each method.

checklist.question: What are the means of your customers onboarding to your product (Acquisition)?
checklist.expectation: Measurements of conversion rates and cost of the each method.

checklist.question: How quickly they get to the 'aha' moment with the product (Activation)?
checklist.expectation: Knowledge on the proportion of Customers who get their first win (value) through the product and time/effort taken to get there.

checklist.question: How many of your customers are returning to the product (Retention)?
checklist.expectation: Knowledge and measures of why some customers are not returning. How frequently the returning customers use the product. What are the features making the customers to return?

checklist.question: How many of the customers pay for the product and services (Revenue)?
checklist.expectation: What are the features your customers are willing to pay. How to increase the revenue per customer?

checklist.question: How many of your customers are active advocates (Referral)?
checklist.expectation: How many new awareness/acquisitions obtained through customer referrals? How can we improve that?

checklist.question: Do you measure your AAARRR as a funnel and know where the bottlenecks are?
checklist.expectation: Visualization of the funnel and conversion statistics at each funnel stage.

checklist.question: Do you maintain a list of experiments, their results and what tactics bring the most impact on your target market?
checklist.expectation: Innovation accounting done on the experiments to identify the most effective growth hacking tactics for your business.

frontMatter.title: IPR Management
frontMatter.metaDescription: Take actions to protect intellectual property of your business and technical innovations. Take necessary actions such as patenting, copyrights and non-disclosure agreements and validating compatibility of third-party licenses.

checklist.question: Have you identified Intellectual Property (IP) artificats in the project?
checklist.expectation: Consider project code, graphical elements, icons, etc... can be identified as IP.

checklist.question: Do you have legal agreements like NDA, NCC etc... ready to sign with partners and contractors?
checklist.expectation: You should have the required legal agreements to sign with the employees, outsourced development teams, business partnets etc...

frontMatter.title: Product Theme Integration
frontMatter.metaDescription: Product theme represents the image of your product. This action focuses on integrating the previously set product theme, visual element library to code with specific guidelines for developers.

checklist.question: Have you identified a theme for your product?
checklist.expectation: Identifying a product theme is important as it represents how you want a customer to notice your product.

frontMatter.title: Quality Assurance Plan
frontMatter.metaDescription: Consists of a systematic process to ensure the delivery of the product with expected quality. This includes test case formulation, verification process (regression and smoke testing), test automation and release quality management.

checklist.question: Have you identified the quality requirements of the product?
checklist.expectation: Identifying the quality requirements is the first activity of creating a Quality Assurance Plan for your product.

checklist.question: How do you Quality Control your production releases?
checklist.expectation: The quality control could include quality verification process such as regressions and smoke testing.

checklist.question: How do you ensure the non-functional requirements are met in the product?
checklist.expectation: Testing the non-functional requirments should be a part of your Quality Control process.

frontMatter.title: Quality Assurance Strategy
frontMatter.metaDescription: Defining quality objectives, test approaches, techniques & scope of a software project

checklist.question: Have you identified all the activities that would need to be performed to ensure quality starting from requirement analysis to deployment?
checklist.expectation: Identifying all the activities required to ensure quality would help in building an effective Quality Assurance Strategy

checklist.question: Have you defined a process to capture root causes of defects?
checklist.expectation: Root causes of defects should be identified and used as an input to identify areas of improvement

checklist.question: Have you captured potential risks that may affect the successful execution of the QA strategy?
checklist.expectation: Risks along with their impact and mitigation strategy should be identified

frontMatter.title: Release Management
frontMatter.metaDescription: A set of processes and practices to follow when making changes to the existing system. Changes can be categorized as bug fixes, feature development and Platform/UX/Technology Shift.

frontMatter.title: Requirement Process
frontMatter.metaDescription: Process of deriving, defining, communicating, documenting, prioritizing and obtaining user feedback.

checklist.question: Is there an established product road map?
checklist.expectation: All team members should be aware of the product road map. Road map should clearly indicate the upcoming features and their time lines.

checklist.question: Is there a process to get customer feedback?
checklist.expectation: A clear process should be in place to get customer feedback of the product. This feedback ideally needs to be captured during the development phase it self by involving customer in early prototypes.

checklist.question: How are the features prioritized?
checklist.expectation: Features needs to be prioritized based on user preference data. There has to be evidence of collecting this data from the customers.

frontMatter.title: Team Structure
frontMatter.metaDescription: Defines key roles, job responsibilities, boundaries, and values of the team. Everyone should understand who does what and their purpose in the team.

checklist.question: Have you identified different roles and skills required for the team?
checklist.expectation: Able to show list of roles covering major aspects of product eng. and under each skillset, list of roles from Product Mgt. to DevOps

checklist.question: Have you identified a communication and escalation plan?
checklist.expectation: By way of documentation and able to illustrate how communication should take place from requirement gathering to escalating risks and plans.

checklist.question: Have you identified a set of KPIs for members playing in specified roles?
checklist.expectation: Defined KPI which has been communicated to team members

docs.title: Retire
docs.description: Regardless of how well the product is built and maintained, theres a time to take it off the market. Retirement can be brought on by a significant technology shift, competitor entrance, or user behaviour changes in the market.

frontMatter.title: Retire
frontMatter.metaDescription: Replacing the existing product with a new generation product.

frontMatter.title: Data Migration Plan
frontMatter.metaDescription: A systematic plan to smoothly migrate data (system data, users, user data, etc.) from the old platform to a new platform with feature compatibility. Have a migration strategy.

checklist.question: Have you identified the data source and storage?
checklist.expectation: Provide an overview of the current state of data, its storage, and potential restrictions.

checklist.question: Who is going to involve in migration?
checklist.expectation: Identify key stakeholders, relevant subject matter experts and everyone that has a voice in this project.

checklist.question: What are you going to migrate?
checklist.expectation: Which data will your migration require? And any relevant reports for the legacy data, including the frequency of use and whether or not you analyze trends in historical data.

frontMatter.title: Digital Data Shredding
